website_summaries.verdict: With more flex that the typical glove, it’s an excellent first catcher’s mitt for a youth player.
pros: Includes extra padding to handle the sting of a fast pitch while cutting down on the rebound from a pitch that doesn’t hit square in the pocket
Liner in palm area increases comfort
Measures 32.5 inches, so it’s a bit bigger than some other gloves for kids
cons: Probably wouldn’t meet the needs of an advanced youth player

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My son is 9 and just starting catching. He needed a good glove that wouldn't take too long to break in. He loves this glove. It fits well, and was broken in enough to use in a game after one good practice. It's a youth glove, but it fits my hand as well so I was also able to catch with it to help him break it in (I'm 5'3" so my hand is smaller). I think it'll work for him for at least 2 seasons. I had bought a 33" glove too and can't believe how much bigger it was even though it was only a 1/2" bigger. Highly recommend for young catchers!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Schlachter

customer_reviews.title: Ready to play ball out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Good to go out of the box for my 9 yr old. I'll adjust after he use it a bit more. No breaking in required but a little will only make it better. I was worried the 32.5 would be too big but after seeing it, I'm glad I didn't go with a 31.5. This one is a good size for a 9 - 11yr old.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin E

customer_reviews.title: Good price, great glove, & almost game ready out of the box
customer_reviews.text: My son left his catcher's mitt at the field (who'd have expected that) after a recent game & needed a new mitt immediately for the upcoming game. Purchased this glove based on reviews - great call. Glove was extremely flexible & required almost no break in, but still provided a very good pocket & sufficient padding to handle the best his pitchers (9-11 yrs) could throw at him. With minimal effort, the glove was ready for his next game - crisis averted & wallet spared.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Great glove for my sons age and price.
customer_reviews.text: Nice glove for the price and my sons age. My son has been a catcher for the last three years and this is a nice transitional glove from youth to adult. He just turned 10 and plays tournament ball. Really well made and at this age can’t see paying more for a glove that might have a few more bells and whistles. Another plus is how easy it is to break in.
customer_reviews.author: Michael N.

customer_reviews.title: More broken in than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 9 year old son, who is catching for the first time this year. I bought it, anticipating having to break it in before he could even use it, but he talked me into trying it out. The first couple of innings, he had a few balls hit the pocket, and then fall out. Before the game was over with, he figuring it out and was starting to catch them more. I hadn't even put any oils on it yet, and it was already starting to break in. I was really impressed. his fielding glove is also a Mizuno, and we've had really good luck with it.
customer_reviews.author: JYOUNG

customer_reviews.title: Almost ready to go when you get it!
customer_reviews.text: My grandson started baseball this year with a knack for catching,so being Papaw Plus him being left handed I started searching out gloves. I checked this Mizuno out liked how it felt and knew it would break in easy and fit him well. Amazon had it cheaper than my local store plus the free shipping so you couldn’t beat it. He loves it and was able to use it right out of the box. They then took it home and cleaned it up and oiled it tied it up and since then he’s really “catching on “!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph K Lassiter

customer_reviews.title: My son likes this mitt. It held up for ...
customer_reviews.text: My son likes this mitt. It held up for the duration of the season. I got the bigger size 32.5 because I read the ball might pop out more frequently with the smaller one.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle F.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect startup catcher’s mitt
customer_reviews.text: So easy to break in, got it for our 10 year old and not some of his teammates are using it too. It definitely needs to be broken in, but it’s very soft already when it comes. Nothing oiling, a mallet and throwing and catching can’t fix. We got it because it was rated #1 for young players from an independent website, and they weren’t wrong.
customer_reviews.author: E. Alarcon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent glove for my 9 year old
customer_reviews.text: This catchers mitt came almost completely broken in. My 9 year old started using it immediately and while it’s not completely broken it it’s very close. The Mizuno hinge allows it to close very easily. Great beginners glove for catchers 10 and under.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Mennone

customer_reviews.title: Ready out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mitt for my 10 year old son who catches 4 to 6 innings every game and warms up pitchers prior to each game. I needed a mitt that was ready to go as I bought it right at the start of the season. He loves this mitt. Has good protection and works well with his thumb guard. Half way into the season and holding up well. I do check and tighten all laces prior to each game. Good for this age level and pitch speed. Great Mitt for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Catchers Glove
customer_reviews.text: Our little leaguer needed an updated catchers mitt. The day this arrived, we broke it in and he used it that evening. He says he really like it and the balls stay in the pocket better than his last glove used at catcher.
customer_reviews.author: Robb

customer_reviews.title: great glove would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: good quality glove not super soft. needs brake just like any other glove has relief cut in palm area helps with closing glove ,this is good in the brake in period.so the my son can still close glove .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great glove
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my grandson for his birthday. He is all into baseball, and playing every position. He’s 9. He loved it and has been practicing his catching with it
customer_reviews.author: gramat

customer_reviews.title: For boys fast pitch only
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grand daughter softball fast pitch. But to small. I put in left handed catchers mitt for softball fast pitch and it came up. Can’t use it now she tried out and couldnt catch a ball. More for little league. But she loved it how it didn’t need to be broken in. Hope I can return and start over
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we were looking for
customer_reviews.text: My son LOVES it! It was already pretty broken in when it arrived, and was quick to break in fully. There are gloves w/deeper pockets, but my kid catches well with this glove. It’s made of soft leather and is a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole D.

customer_reviews.title: ... way broken in however this one gives you a nice head start
customer_reviews.text: No glove is all the way broken in however this one gives you a nice head start. After about 300 pops with a glove mallet and 100 balls in the front yard the glove is perfect. This glove is ideal for 8-11 year olds. Maybe even a little older. I also put some lanolin glove paste on it which helped a little more. Ready to use in our first game tonight. Im absolutely positive that we will catch and hold onto a lot more balls with this glove.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Man

customer_reviews.title: Great catchers glove...
customer_reviews.text: Really nice catchers glove. My kids all play ball and we've learned to buy Mizuno gloves because of how quickly they break-in. They don't last forever but my kids love how soft they are once they are broken-in. This glove actually looks like it will last several years at least. 10yo son is using it and it fits him well.
customer_reviews.author: EZ Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Great mitt for the price!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my eight year old nephew whose hands were a little small. Within a couple hours of play he was able to open and close it without much effort and it seems to work well. It's an intermediate quality Mitt and will work well for those that are in a transitional and learning stage of the game. Overall quality is great and with a little bit of oil it's easily manipulated.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Spiker

customer_reviews.title: Game-ready on arrival
customer_reviews.text: My son is a lefty and tried out the catchers position using his regular glove. He decided he loved the position, so I started researching the best “game-ready” glove. This was exactly what I needed. The glove took only a little use to become super easy to close. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Rangerkel9

customer_reviews.title: GREAT YOUTH MITT
customer_reviews.text: Easy to break in and well made glove. My grandson loves it and he was able catch a game with it a few days after he got it with no issue. It has a nice deep pocket and rest of the mitt is well padded. Great glove for the price.
customer_reviews.author: DowntownRDB

customer_reviews.title: My son loves it, no brake in needed
customer_reviews.text: This catchers mitt was the best thing ever, my son became 2 times better with this glove, it does make a difference, i guarantee it
customer_reviews.author: PETER CERDA

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Had to get a different glove does not provide enough padding and was hurting the catchers hand.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Berens

customer_reviews.title: It does very well
customer_reviews.text: It takes some time to break in but it has great padding and the catchers love it.

customer_reviews.title: Great glove
customer_reviews.text: Very little break in needed. Fits 8 yr old very well with room to grow.
customer_reviews.author: Christian A.

customer_reviews.title: Great mitt for little league
customer_reviews.text: Mitt appears to be well built. My almost 11 year old was able to close the mitt and catch a ball with it. It’s January in upstate NY so we won’t know more till spring but looks and feels great! Confident of no issues
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I’d Buy Again!
customer_reviews.text: Great starter glove for young catchers learning how to play the position. My son is a lefty, so being a catcher isn’t likely in his future, but he wanted one nonetheless to play around with. The fact that a lefty version was available was nice. I’d buy another one if the need arose.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great youth catcher’s mit
customer_reviews.text: Do not hesitate to purchase this mit. My son is 9 and we were able to break in this mit over the weekend. Good quality. Very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 10 year old son. Wasn’t as broken in as like wrapped it for several days. OverAll good mitt

customer_reviews.title: Great mitt
customer_reviews.text: Very good mitt, by son just started playing catcher for an afterschool team and this mitt was a good product at a good price. It was comfortable and we're very happy with it!

customer_reviews.title: Great catchers mitt!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome catchers mitt! My son is a smaller 9 year old so I was worried the 32.50 size glove would be too big for my son. It fit perfect for him with plenty of room to grow into it. Not much breaking in is needed for this mitt. Within a couple innings it was good to go. He and I both are very happy with this mitt.

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great as you still have to break it in properly.
customer_reviews.text: Good not for my 9 year old. A bit stiff even after trying to break it in. Outside is soft.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Good Choice
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son who plays U8 baseball. It’s a great fit for him, super soft, and almost completely broken in right out of the box. For a young or beginner player this would be a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Santamarina

customer_reviews.title: Great mitt!!
customer_reviews.text: This comes broke in already!!! Great glove for kid pitch.
customer_reviews.author: Purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Excellent youth glove for those with larger hands
customer_reviews.text: This is our 2nd one; the first one lasted two years. The 32.5" is apparently considered a transitional size, and the padding on this one is moderate. While sufficient for league play up through 12yo majors and intrastate competition, I think we'll have to replace it for something more sturdy (and heavier) by 8th grade. We looked at 33" adult gloves, and they are about 50% heavier to start, moving up quickly. That much weight could be detrimental to development, and will certainly cause faster fatigue in a young person's arm. That being said, it's a solid, well-made glove that has been great for two full competitive seasons.
customer_reviews.author: Scott ValentineTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great beginners catchers mitt
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 9 year old son. It is very soft, this not requiring the typical breaking in period. Great beginners catchers mitt.

customer_reviews.text: Ready to play out of the bag . Broken in Just a little glove conditioner and good to go.

I would recommend to anyone that needs a catcher's glove to use ASAP without the long break-in period. I'm sure are a few more games it will feel even better.

product_meta.title: Mizuno Prospect GXC105 Youth Catcher's Mitt
product_meta.description: The Mizuno Prospect GXC105 is a 32.50" Youth Transitional sized catcher's mitt that features Mizuno's Power Close technology, which makes it easier for younger players to close the mitt. Also features the patented Para Shock palm, which absorbs the shock of repeated use, providing less rebound, outstanding protection, and ideal comfort.
feature_bullets: ButterSoft Palm Liner: PU palm lining for increased durability, feel, and comfort.
Less 2 Lacing: Removes the last 2 lace loops on the web to increase flexibility along the closing axis.
Parashock Palm Pad: Mizuno's exclusive palm pad absorbs the shock of repeated use providing outstanding protection and ideal comfort
PowerClose Technology: Makes catching easy for younger players.
PowerLock: Provides the quickest and most secure fit available.
